it.polimi.group06.domain

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.group06.domain.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Class containing all the element needed to play a briscola game, and wrapper methods abstracting the usage of the object it instantiates.
    Author:
    Denis

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Game()
      Creates a new game with two players.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean gameIsOver()
      Checks if there are still rounds to play, i.e. the game is not finished
      int getCurrentPlayer() 
      Player[] getPlayers() 
      int getRound() 
      int getStartingPlayer() 
      Table getTable() 
      void newRound()
      Initializes a new round by defining the current round winner, assigning the played cards to the winning player, distributing new cards if still any, advancing the round number, and updating the starting and the current player

      Plays a card of a player
      int returnWinner()
      Returns the winner at the end of a game, it should be called when the game is over.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game()
        Creates a new game with two players. The first player is a human, the second a robot, the human player starts the first round. The deck is not shuffled.

        public void setCurrentPlayer(int currentPlayer)

      • toConfiguration

        public java.lang.String toConfiguration()
        Computes the String representing the actual configuration of the game
        Returns:
        String for the game configuration

      • gameIsOver

        public boolean gameIsOver()
        Checks if there are still rounds to play, i.e. the game is not finished
        Returns:
        True if there is no round left to be played, False if the game is not over

      • roundIsOver

        public boolean roundIsOver()
        Checks if there are not cards yet to be played in the current round
        Returns:
        True if all players have already played their card, False otherwise

      • playerPlaysCard

        public void playerPlaysCard(int playerNum,
                            int cardPos)
        Plays a card of a player
        Parameters:
        playerNum - the id of player that plays the card
        cardPos - the position of the card in the hand of the player

      • newRound

        public void newRound()
        Initializes a new round by defining the current round winner, assigning the played cards to the winning player, distributing new cards if still any, advancing the round number, and updating the starting and the current player

      • returnWinner

        public int returnWinner()
        Returns the winner at the end of a game, it should be called when the game is over.
        Returns:
        The id of the winning player.
